==Chinese==

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – [[thatched]] [[cottage]]; [[house]]. Original form of {{och-l|舍|house}}.

===Etymology 1===
{{zh-see|餘}}

===Etymology 2===
{{zh-forms}}
Related to {{och-l|予|I|id=1}}, {{och-l|台|I|id=4}} and {{och-l|朕|my; I}}, forming the ''*l-'' series of first-person Old Chinese personal pronouns. This series is commonly used by {{w|Shang Dynasty}} kings to refer to themselves.

In contrast, Old Chinese also had the ''*ŋ-'' series of first-person pronouns, represented by {{och-l|我|I}} and {{och-l|吾|I}}, which became more widely used over time.
